00021 class DriverStation : public SensorBase
00022 {
00023 public:
00024     enum Alliance {kRed, kBlue, kInvalid};
00025 
00026     virtual ~DriverStation();
00027     static DriverStation *GetInstance();
00028 
00029     static const UINT32 kBatterySlot = 1;
00030     static const UINT32 kBatteryChannel = 8;
00031     static const UINT32 kJoystickPorts = 4;
00032     static const UINT32 kJoystickAxes = 6;
00033 
00034     float GetStickAxis(UINT32 stick, UINT32 axis);
00035     short GetStickButtons(UINT32 stick);
00036 
00037     float GetAnalogIn(UINT32 channel);
00038     bool GetDigitalIn(UINT32 channel);
00039     void SetDigitalOut(UINT32 channel, bool value);
00040     bool GetDigitalOut(UINT32 channel);
00041 
00042     bool IsEnabled();
00043     bool IsDisabled();
00044     bool IsAutonomous();
00045     bool IsOperatorControl();

00047     bool IsFMSAttached();
00048 
00049     UINT32 GetPacketNumber();
00050     Alliance GetAlliance();
00051     UINT32 GetLocation();
00052 
00053     float GetBatteryVoltage();
00054 
00055     // Get the default dashboard packers. These instances stay around even after
00056     // a call to SetHigh|LowPriorityDashboardPackerToUse() changes which packer
00057     // is in use. You can restore the default high priority packer by calling
00058     // SetHighPriorityDashboardPackerToUse(&GetHighPriorityDashboardPacker()).
00059     Dashboard& GetHighPriorityDashboardPacker() { return m_dashboardHigh; }
00060     Dashboard& GetLowPriorityDashboardPacker() { return m_dashboardLow; }
00061 
00062     // Get/set the dashboard packers to use. This can sideline or restore the
00063     // default packers. Initializing SmartDashboard changes the high priority
00064     // packer in use so beware that the default packer will then be idle. These
00065     // methods support any kind of DashboardBase, e.g. a Dashboard or a
00066     // SmartDashboard.
00067     DashboardBase* GetHighPriorityDashboardPackerInUse() { return m_dashboardInUseHigh; }
00068     DashboardBase* GetLowPriorityDashboardPackerInUse() { return m_dashboardInUseLow; }
00069     void SetHighPriorityDashboardPackerToUse(DashboardBase* db) { m_dashboardInUseHigh = db; }
00070     void SetLowPriorityDashboardPackerToUse(DashboardBase* db) { m_dashboardInUseLow = db; }
00071 
00072     DriverStationEnhancedIO& GetEnhancedIO() { return m_enhancedIO; }
00073 
00074     void IncrementUpdateNumber() { m_updateNumber++; }
00075     SEM_ID GetUserStatusDataSem() { return m_statusDataSemaphore; }
00076 
00077 protected:
00078     DriverStation();
00079 
00080     void GetData();
00081     void SetData();
00082 
00083 private:
00084     static void InitTask(DriverStation *ds);
00085     static DriverStation *m_instance;
00087     static const float kUpdatePeriod = 0.02;
00088 
00089     void Run();
00090 
00091     struct FRCCommonControlData *m_controlData;
00092     UINT8 m_digitalOut;
00093     AnalogChannel *m_batteryChannel;
00094     SEM_ID m_statusDataSemaphore;
00095     Task m_task;
00096     Dashboard m_dashboardHigh;  // the default dashboard packers
00097     Dashboard m_dashboardLow;
00098     DashboardBase* m_dashboardInUseHigh;  // the current dashboard packers in use
00099     DashboardBase* m_dashboardInUseLow;
00100     bool m_newControlData;
00101     SEM_ID m_packetDataAvailableSem;
00102     DriverStationEnhancedIO m_enhancedIO;
00103     static UINT8 m_updateNumber;
00104 };
